Description:
Executive Support:Provide high-level administrative support to senior executives, including managing calendars, scheduling meetings, and coordinating travel arrangements.
Prepare and edit correspondence, reports, presentations, and other documents as requested by executives.
Handle incoming phone calls and emails, responding on behalf of executives or directing them to the appropriate parties.Document Control:Develop and maintain a systematic document management system to ensure the proper storage, retrieval, and tracking of critical company documents.
Monitor and control document versions and revisions, ensuring that documents are up to date and in compliance with organizational standards.
Establish and enforce document retention and disposal policies to maintain data integrity and compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.Record Keeping:Maintain accurate records of important company documents, contracts, and agreements.
Create and manage a secure and organized digital and physical filing system for easy document retrieval.
Track and report on document status, including approvals, signatures, and expiration dates.Communication and Collaboration:Serve as a liaison between executives and other departments or external partners.
Coordinate and schedule meetings, conferences, and appointments for executives, ensuring efficient communication and follow-up.
Facilitate effective communication flow by distributing documents, reports, and memos as needed.Confidentiality:Handle sensitive and confidential information with the utmost discretion and professionalism.
Implement and maintain strict security protocols for confidential documents and data.Compliance:Ensure all documents are in compliance with relevant industry standards, regulations, and company policies.
Assist in audits and compliance checks related to document management processes.Skills
Skills:
Bachelor's degree in business administration, office management, or a related field preferred.
Fluent in Arabic.
Proven experience as an executive assistant or document controller.
Strong organizational skills with an acute attention to detail.
Proficiency in document management software and Microsoft Office Suite.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
Discretion and integrity in handling confidential information.

The Executive Assistant / Document Controller plays a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of an organization by providing vital administrative support and maintaining a structured document management system. This position requires a proactive and organized individual capable of handling a wide range of responsibilities efficiently and professionally.
